intro: Cardamine oligosperma subsp. kamtschatica, commonly known as Kamtschatskian watercress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has small, alternate leaves that are often lobed or divided, and its flowers are arranged in clusters of two. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different morphology and geographic distribution compared to other Cardamine species.
